resources:
SweetSavor Sweet\nSavor Easy chocolate molten cakes Salted chocolate & hazelnut brownies Chocolate truffle & honeycomb torte Treacle tart Peach Melba pie Easy cornflake tart Vanilla panna cotta Nanaimo bars Floating islands Blackberry & lemon fool Chocolate tiffin White chocolate cheesecake
Gelatine Milk Caster sugar Strawberry Raspberry Blackberry Lemon Double cream Butter Eggs Dark chocolate White chocolate Milk chocolate Mascarpone Soft sugar Raisin Cream Cheese Icing sugar Custard powder Chopped almonds Desiccated coconut Biscuits Cocoa powder Syrup Softened butter Honey Cornflakes Chocolate Hazelnut Flour Nuts Ice cream Caramel sauce Salt Egg yolks Water Ginger Breadcrumbs Peach Cornflour Vanilla Muscovado sugar Demerara sugar Pastry Jam Custard
3 x 40g chocolate-covered honeycomb bar 100g cornflakes 500g dark chocolate (at least 70% cocoa solids), broken into small pieces 3 tbsp golden syrup 400ml double cream Try this easy no-bake dessert which uses just five ingredients. As well as looking great as a centrepiece, it‘s easy to carry to a gathering.
3 x 40g chocolate-covered honeycomb bar 100g cornflakes 500g dark chocolate (at least 70% cocoa solids), broken into small pieces 3 tbsp golden syrup 400ml double cream 3 tbsp golden syrup 400ml double cream Bake an impressive dinner party dessert with minimum fuss – these chocolate puddings, also known as chocolate fondant or lava cake, have a lovely gooey centre
100g slightly salted butter, cut into small pieces, plus extra for the tin 200g 70% dark chocolate, broken into chunks 150g chocolate and hazelnut spread 200g golden caster sugar 150g plain flour 100g toasted pecan nuts, roughly chopped ice cream and caramel sauce, to serve 3 eggs, beaten Chocolate hazelnut spread ensures these moreish brownies have a fudgy centre. Flecked with pecans and sea salt - they\'ll be the new go-to brownie recipe
250g plain flour 140g cold unsalted butter, cubed 3 tbsp icing sugar ½ tsp fine salt 2 medium egg yolks 2–3 tbsp cold water 400g golden syrup 1 ball stem ginger in syrup, finely chopped, plus 50g of the syrup 1 lemon, zested 2 medium eggs, lightly beaten 100g fine fresh white breadcrumbs Treat family and friends to a comforting treacle tart with crumbly pastry and rich filling. A classic British dessert, serve with ice cream or clotted cream
175g self-raising flour, plus extra for dusting 175g white spelt flour 160g unsalted butter, chilled and cubed 4 ripe peaches ½ lemon, juiced 1 tbsp cornflour 1 tsp vanilla extract 3 tbsp light muscovado sugar 1 tbsp runny blossom honey 200g raspberries 10g chilled butter 1 egg, beaten 2 tbsp demerara sugar vanilla ice cream or whipped cream, to serve Have some raspberries that are a little past their best? Use them to make this fabulous Peach Melba pie – a wonderful combination of raspberries and peaches
320g ready-rolled shortcrust pastry plain flour, to dust 50g butter 125g golden syrup 25g light brown soft sugar 100g cornflakes 125g strawberry or raspberry jam custard, to serve Make this cornflake cake for a fabulously easy family dessert that uses simple ingredients. With a pastry case and jam base, it\'s delicious served with custard
500ml whole milk 2 tsp vanilla bean paste 4 large egg yolks (save the white of 1 egg and freeze the rest for another recipe) 100g caster sugar 1 large egg white 50g caster sugar 200ml whole milk 50g caster sugar Whip up some floating islands at your next dinner party, the retro-cool French dessert featuring crème anglaise, meringue and caramel
200g blackberries, plus extra for the topping 3 tbsp icing sugar zest and juice of ½ a lemon 250ml double cream Create this delicious pudding in just 10 minutes, then pop it in the fridge. Serve in glasses and garnish with fresh blackberries for an elegant summer dessert
150g butter, cubed, plus extra for the tin 3 tbsp caster sugar 3 tbsp golden syrup 6 tsp cocoa powder 225g biscuits, crushed handful of raisins 110g milk chocolate 110g dark chocolate Go all out and treat yourself to these chocolate tiffin slices, full of milk and dark chocolate, raisins and biscuit. Be warned: they won\'t last long!
300g digestive biscuits 150g unsalted butter, melted, plus extra to grease 400g white chocolate, broken into pieces 300g full-fat cream cheese (we used Philadelphia) 250g mascarpone 300ml double cream 200g strawberries or raspberries, to serve Make a simple, creamy dessert for a dinner party with very little effort. Pairing this white chocolate cheesecake with fresh fruit offsets the richness
125g softened butter 50g caster sugar 5 tbsp cocoa powder 1 egg, beaten 200g digestive biscuits, blitzed to crumbs 100g desiccated coconut 50g chopped almonds (optional) 100g butter, softened 4 tbsp double cream 3 tbsp custard powder 250g icing sugar 150g dark chocolate 50g butter Need ideas for a coffee morning or afternoon tea? These bars from Canada are so moreish, with a crunchy biscuit base, custard layer and chocolate topping
2 ½ sheets gelatine 150ml milk 60g caster sugar 1 vanilla pod, split lengthways fresh strawberries, to serve 400ml double cream strawberry compote, to serve Try making this classic Italian dessert with delicate vanilla and a fresh strawberry topping. The perfect light sweet for a chilled summer gathering

Add to Cart - + Delivery time %d Min Favorites Cart This damson and apple crumble will go down a treat as a family dessert. The damsons will contain stones, so remember to warn people to remove them as they eat Damson crumble Chocolate & malt loaf torte Don’t be deceived by how easy this is to make – the result is a rich, dense cake with a malted coating. Eat it warm as a pudding or serve it with afternoon tea Raspberry brûlée Celebrate raspberry season with this take on crème brûlée. The sharp tang of this red fruit cuts through a rich custard base for the perfect summer dessert Chocolate hazelnut ice cream cheesecake No one will guess that this easy, rich and creamy no-cook, make-ahead cheesecake uses only 4 ingredients - ideal for a dinner party Black Forest tart Sweet cocoa pastry is filled with a rich, fruity filling of chocolate and cherries in this heavenly German gateau-inspired dessert Raspberry & pistachio parfait New York cheesecake This authentic creamy dessert will add a taste of New York to any dining table. Our American-style baked cheesecake recipe makes an easy family dessert.
